data.title: Quantum BioPharma Ltd. announces an at-the-market offering of Class B shares up to $21,225,000 with a 3.0% commission to sales agent Wainwright.
data.description: Quantum BioPharma Ltd. (NASDAQ: QNTM) (CSE: QNTM) (FRA: 0K9A) announced today its initiation of an at-the-market offering agreement with H.C. Wainwright & Co., LLC. The agreement, effective as of February 16, 2024, allows Quantum to offer and sell Class B Subordinate Voting Shares totaling up to US$21,225,000 through Wainwright as the sales agent. It is noted that a cash commission of 3.0% will be paid to Wainwright based on the total gross proceeds attained through the ATM Offering. Quantum, a biopharmaceutical company focused on innovative assets and biotech solutions, is enthusiastic about this opportunity for financial growth.

data.title: Sei (SEI) price drops 7% post Robinhood listing, amid broader market downturn and bearish technical signals.
data.description: The value of Sei (SEI) token has dropped by more than 7% after being listed on Robinhood, as the overall cryptocurrency market faces a downturn. Technical indicators are pointing towards additional decreases in value.

data.title: NASA secures Moon lander backups from SpaceX & Blue Origin amid China's rising lunar ambitions; Elon Musk faces criticism.
data.description: NASA is concerned about China potentially winning the upcoming moon race. Meanwhile, Elon Musk and his company faced criticism from detractors.

data.title: Nordea plans to introduce Bitcoin synthetic ETPs in December 2025, aligning with European crypto regulations.
data.description: Starting in December 2025, Nordea plans to introduce synthetic ETPs linked to Bitcoin, representing a notable advancement in crypto acceptance within Europe under the MiCA regulations.

data.title: Fed Chair Powell hints at possible rate cuts, sparking S&P 500 rally; odds of cut in Sept fall to around 70%.
data.description: There is still anticipation in the markets for a rate reduction next month, although the likelihood has decreased to approximately 70%. Following remarks from Fed Chair Powell indicating that current conditions "may warrant" rate cuts, the S&P 500 experienced a surge, reacting positively to his speech at Jackson Hole.

data.title: High PPI inflation dashes hopes for big Fed rate cut; Trump administration calls for half-point cut next month. S&P 500 drops.
data.description: The Trump administration is advocating for a 0.5% reduction in interest rates in the upcoming month. However, hopes for a significant rate cut by the Federal Reserve were dampened by higher than expected Producer Price Index (PPI) inflation figures. Consequently, the S&P 500 index experienced a decline in response to these developments.

data.title: Core CPI inflation surpasses 3%, won't halt Fed; S&P 500 increases. Fed rate cuts remain unaffected.
data.description: The latest data reveals a significant increase in the core CPI inflation rate, surpassing 3%. Despite this rise, it is not substantial enough to prevent the Federal Reserve from implementing rate cuts. Concurrently, the S&P 500 experienced growth following the announcement.

data.title: Job cuts increased by 140% in July compared to a year ago. The Fed's preferred inflation measure exceeded expectations. S&P 500 rose.
data.description: Recent data reveals a significant increase in job cuts, with a 140% rise compared to the previous year in July. Additionally, the Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure exceeded expectations. This news comes as the S&P 500 index saw a positive trend, climbing higher.

data.title: Dow Jones Futures: Nvidia, Microsoft, Palantir, Tesla all in buy zones after market rally on Monday.
data.description: On Monday, Dow Jones Futures revealed that Nvidia, Microsoft, Palantir, and Tesla were situated in buy zones following a surge in the stock market. This news comes after a significant market rally. This information is valuable for investors looking to capitalize on potential opportunities in the market.

data.title: Raytech Holding Limited (NASDAQ: RAY) faces Nasdaq delisting as stock falls below $1 per share for 30 days on Oct. 14.
data.description: On October 14, 2025, Raytech Holding Limited (NASDAQ: RAY), headquartered in Hong Kong and specializing in personal care electrical appliances, received notice from the Listing Qualifications Department of Nasdaq. The letter stated that due to the closing bid price of the company's ordinary shares remaining below $1 for the last 30 consecutive business days, Raytech no longer complies with Nasdaq Listing Rules 5550(a)(2) requiring a minimum bid price of $1 per share to maintain listing eligibility.

data.title: Stock indexes surged to new highs on cool CPI data, with Dow Jones, S&P 500, and Nasdaq reaching record levels.
data.description: Following the release of lower-than-anticipated Consumer Price Index (CPI) numbers, the Dow Jones index and several other key indexes surged to record highs. The stock market today saw the Dow, S&P 500, and Nasdaq all closing at new peaks on the back of this encouraging CPI data. This positive trend reflects a growing investor confidence in the market as the Dow Jones and other major indexes experience significant gains.

data.title: Dow falls 300 points, Netflix misses earnings, Tesla results pending. Market update by Investor's Business Daily.
data.description: Today, the Dow Jones index experienced a decline of 300 points as Netflix faced a significant drop in earnings. Following this, Tesla is set to announce their earnings after the market close. This update on the stock market was covered live by Investor's Business Daily.

data.title: Dow Jones Futures: Apple, Google, Netflix, Tesla see gains while Oracle stock drops, Investor's Business Daily reports.
data.description: On Monday, Dow Jones Futures saw positive movements from major companies such as Apple, Google, Netflix, and Tesla. However, Oracle stock experienced a downward trend. This news highlights the bullish momentum for Apple, Google, Netflix, and Tesla, while Oracle faced selling pressure. The market reaction showcased a positive day for the technology sector, with significant shifts in stock prices. This update showcases the dynamic nature of the stock market, with Apple, Google, Netflix, Tesla showing strength, while Oracle faced challenges. Notably, investors closely monitored these developments to make informed decisions in response to the market fluctuations.

data.title: Dow increased, Nvidia eyed buy point, Apple near buy points in stock market. Warren Buffett stocks observed. Dow Jones index rose Monday.
data.description: On Monday, the Dow Jones index experienced an increase while Nvidia showed interest in a potential purchase opportunity in the stock market today. Apple was also identified among the Warren Buffett stocks close to entry points. The latest stock market update highlighted the Dow's jump alongside Nvidia's possible entry, with Apple standing out as one of the stocks within Warren Buffett's portfolio nearing buy thresholds. The report provided live coverage of these market movements, showcasing the ongoing investor activity and potential opportunities in the market.

data.title: Tariff truce US-China could stabilize crypto market, easing concerns & reducing volatility.
data.description: The latest agreement to ease tariffs between the United States and China has the potential to bring stability to the cryptocurrency market. This development may help alleviate worries about global economic growth and lead to a decrease in volatility among various risky assets.
u.s. faa: air traffic staffing challenges at over 35 spots, major challenges in northeast
G7 ENERGY MINISTERS ISSUE JOINT STATEMENT ON UKRAINE’S ENERGY SECURITY

data.title: ZachXBT reveals connection between theft and Garden Finance, with over 25% volume linked to stolen funds. Critics slam platform for aiding illegal activity, including North Korean money laundering.
data.description: An examination has found that more than a quarter of Garden Finance's overall volume, estimated at over 25%, has been connected to funds that were stolen. The platform is under scrutiny and receiving backlash for allegedly enabling unlawful activities, such as aiding in North Korean money laundering schemes.

data.title: Datavault AI responds to Wolfpack Research's malicious short report; affirms strength in data tokenization and management. CEO Nathaniel T. Bradley targeted.
data.description: On October 31, 2025, Datavault AI, a prominent player in data tokenization and management listed on NASDAQ under the ticker DVLT, responded to a negative report by Wolfpack Research targeting the company and its CEO, Nathaniel T. Bradley. The report was described as self-serving and malicious by Datavault AI. The company firmly denounces the report and released an official statement in response.

data.title: Home Depot, Foundation pledge $1 million for Hurricane Melissa relief efforts in Caribbean.
data.description: Atlanta-based retailer The Home Depot and its charitable arm, The Home Depot Foundation, have announced a pledge of $1 million in product donations, nonprofit grants, and additional assistance. This initiative aims to offer both immediate relief and extensive support for the recovery of Jamaica and other Caribbean areas that have been severely impacted by recent events.
